metadata.title: CVE-2024-41311 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In Libheif 1.17.6, insufficient checks in ImageOverlay::parse() decoding aheif file containing an overlay image with forged offsets can lead to anout-of-bounds read and write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-41311` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heif-gdk-pixbuf - 1.18.1-2
heif-thumbnailer - 1.18.1-2
libheif-examples - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-aomdec - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-aomenc - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-dav1d - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-ffmpegdec - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-j2kdec - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-j2kenc - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-jpegdec - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-jpegenc - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-kvazaar - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-libde265 - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-rav1e - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-svtenc - 1.18.1-2
libheif-plugin-x265 - 1.18.1-2
libheif1 - 1.18.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libheif package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-2').
